Project Description
Coding4Fun USB Missile Cannon is an application that allows you to control a USB foam missle launcher from your Windows Phone 7 device. The project includes a WP7 application along with a WPF app that listens for incoming commands.

This project does leverage code the USB code for the rocket for the HTTP listening application from http://rocket.codeplex.com/ by Chad Z. Hower.

Requirements:

  • Windows Phone 7 Developer tools (http://developer.windowsphone.com/) FREE!
  • Visual Studio 2010 (http://www.microsoft.com/express/) FREE!
  • a Dream Cheeky missle launcher. ( http://www.dreamcheeky.com/index.php?pagename=product&pid=1 )
    • You can buy them at ThinkGeek at http://www.thinkgeek.com/geektoys/warfare/8a0f for $25.00

To operate, connect your Windows Phone 7 device to the same network as the computer. Start up the WPF http listener application and put in the computer's name in the phone application. From there you can remotely control the USB missle launcher!

The graphics and XAML for the application were produced by 352 Inc (http://www.352inc.com/).
